report_title: Gypsum Product Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Manufacturers in this industry produce gypsum building materials such as wallboards, plasters, moldings, statuaries and architectural plasterwork. As a result, demand for these products is linked to activity in construction markets. Companies have introduced products that improve indoor air quality, which have grown as a revenue share and typically sell at higher prices. Industry profit has benefited most from the vertical integration of the industry's leading companies, which reduces supplier input costs and distribution expenses to downstream markets. Profit is expected to shrink to 5.1% of revenue in 2024, down from 6.2% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential Construction Has Fueled Industry Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The need for gypsum wallboard and associated materials expands in line with residential construction trends. A boom in housing starts in 2021 brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic caused demand to spike. The repair and remodeling sector provides a steady income stream for gypsum product manufacturers. Most spending on house upgrades like plumbing and roofing is non-discretionary and requires gypsum-based products like drywall to cover up.

The industry is densely populated by seven major regional manufacturers known for producing gypsum wallboards. To avoid competing on price alone, businesses continually invest in research and development, introducing new products with advanced features. This practice has created a high barrier to entry, with prospective manufacturers finding it challenging to penetrate existing distribution networks.
Manufacturers have increased profitability and stayed ahead of evolving environmental regulations by streamlining operations and reducing waste.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Residential and commercial construction markets are expected to grow as inflation and mortgage rates cool. Consumers will pursue new homes as macroeconomic conditions ease. Meanwhile, rising corporate profit will likely drive the need for commercial office and warehouse spaces. Also, homeowners must continue routine upkeep regardless of overarching economic conditions. These maintenance needs supply a steady stream of revenue for gypsum manufacturers, securing financial stability and enduring growth for the industry irrespective of overarching economic conditions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Trade and Going Green are Two Trends Happening in the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Gypsum products are physically heavy, making them costly to trade internationally. Still, export activity is expected to expand as USMCA participants expand their construction sectors. Depreciation of the US Dollar will also likely boost demand for US exports.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: There is a great amount of consolidation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The market is very consolidated. During the outlook period, it is anticipated that USG Corporation (USG), New NGC Inc., Georgia-Pacific LLC, Eagle Materials Inc. and Continental Building Products Inc. would maintain their leading market positions. As the industry continues to consolidate, market share concentration is expected to rise. To compete more effectively in localized markets, big businesses are anticipated to buy smaller enterprises. Outside of prices, regional market share and manufacturing efficiency are the main sources of competition.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture gypsum products, such as wallboard, plasters, moldings, statuaries and architectural plaster work. Gypsum product manufacturers may mine, quarry or purchase natural or synthetic gypsum for use in the manufacturing of goods.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - increasing

key_trends: Gypsum product makers compete mostly locally since national competition is constrained by high shipping costs. Consequently, the distribution of gypsum wallboard is often restricted to a small number of multistate regional markets, with the significant producers being well-positioned to offer additional supply to neighboring regions.

Imports are a source of external competition to the industry, although they satisfy a relatively small share of domestic demand. Mainly due to the high costs of shipping gypsum over long distances, the vast majority of imports come from Mexico and Canada.

Revenue boomed in 2021 following a slump in 2020 caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. Gypsum building products are produced in this sector, including wallboard, plaster, moldings, statues and architectural plasterwork.
Revenue continued to climb despite disruptions to the construction market. Non-discretionary home renovations sustained the industry

market_segmentation.segment_description: The repair and remodeling market composes the largest portion of gypsum product sales. Repairs have a less erratic trend than new construction markets, providing a more stable source of demand.
The industry provides plaster compounds, wallboard and architectural moldings to the residential construction market, which is a crucial source of revenue.
The nonresidential construction market, including commercial and institutional buildings, accounts for a notable share of demand for gypsum wallboard and other plaster products.
Repair and remodel projects in the nonresidential sector utilize gypsum products.
Other markets such as agriculture utilize gypsum products.

products_and_services.product_description: Standard gypsum board used for interior walls and ceilings.
Fire-resistant gypsum board designed to improve fire safety.
Gypsum products used in agriculture as soil amendments and other miscellaneous applications.

tier_1_suppliers: Mineral & Phosphate Mining in the US
tier_1_buyers: Apartment & Condominium Construction in the US
tier_2_buyers: Industrial Building Construction in the US
Commercial Building Construction in the US
Municipal Building Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Industry products are used for home improvement projects, so an increase in private spending boosts demand. This spending is relatively stable.
New homes rely heavily on wallboard, so the number of housing starts indicates future demand.
Nonresidential buildings use gypsum products, but to a lesser extent than residential. This market is exposed to real estate volatility.
Higher mortgage rates reduce demand for new homes and the gypsum products used in residential construction.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Rising Demand for Gypsum Products Boosts Imports from USMCA
international_trade_points.trade_description: Interrupted production during COVID-19 caused a spike in demand for imported gypsum products, especially from Mexico.

international_trade_points.trade_title: High Transportation Costs Limit Overseas Imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Gypsum products are bulky, so high transportation costs make overseas imports difficult to justify for downstream markets.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports to USMCA Trade Partners Have Risen
international_trade_points.trade_description: Over 1/3 of exports go to Canada due to proximity and demand. Exports to Mexico have also climbed as its construction sector expands.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Shipments to the Caribbean and Central America
international_trade_points.trade_description: A construction boom in places like Costa Rica and the Bahamas has fueled imports of US gypsum products as they lack domestic production capacity.

business_locations.location_description: One of the largest producers of gypsum products in the Southeast region is Georgia-Pacific, which has several manufacturing facilities in the area.
Florida is also a significant producer of gypsum goods. The state is a notable producer of gypsum wallboard and is home to several sizable gypsum mines.

California is also a major producer of gypsum products, with several extensive manufacturing facilities located in the state. The state is home to several large gypsum mines and it is a significant producer of gypsum wallboard.

Other states in the Western region, such as Oregon, Washington and Utah, also have a presence in the Gypsum Product Manufacturing industry. These states have gypsum mines and manufacturing facilities that produce various gypsum products for construction and other industries.

Texas has the second-highest proportion of industrial establishments among all states. Two major business owners are based in Texas. According to downstream building needs and supply limits, finished goods from the Southwest region are typically shipped to nearby regions.
Texas and Oklahoma account for an estimated one-third of the natural gypsum mined in the United States.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The EPA has stringent, well-defined rules regarding gypsum production and plays a significant regulatory role in the industry. The EPA has required coal-burning plants to scrub their flue gasses and reduce emissions, causing gypsum product manufacturers to turn to synthetic gypsum byproducts.

In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, temporary health and safety regulations, such as social seclusion rules and stay-at-home orders, were set up to varied degrees throughout the United States. Operators in the industry were often allowed to continue operating since they were seen as essential enterprises.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The gypsum product manufacturing industry is mature.
The industry receives low and steady levels of assistance.
There is high and steady competition in the industry.

factors_increased_barrier: The industry is heavily regulated by the Environmental Protection Agency with stringent environmental rules and operational safety measures.
Companies can differentiate through product quality, but products are largely similar.
There are high startup costs impacted by factors like facility size, product type, and automation level.
The industry is moderately labor-intensive with varying manual labor requirements.
There are high input prices and labor costs, as well as need for extensive distribution networks.
factors_decreased_barrier: There is a low but increasing level of globalization in the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Gypsum product makers compete mostly locally due to high shipping costs constraining national competition.
Imports from Mexico and Canada provide some external competition, though satisfying a small share of domestic demand due to high shipping costs.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top 4 companies account for over 75% of industry sales due to economies of scale, vertical integration, and high entry barriers.
The leading companies operate across the continent while remaining companies are smaller regional players.
The market has shrunk due to consolidation, with large manufacturers producing at lower costs and driving out smaller competitors.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases of Material Inputs Represent the Largest Component
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The most important materials bought were starch, paperboard, mineral fiber, perlite and natural and synthetic gypsum. A byproduct of coal plants, synthetic gypsum is heavily utilized by a number of enterprises. As a consequence, changes in coal-powered energy have an impact on the price of synthetic gypsum.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Plants and Equipment Absorb a Significant Share of Industry Revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry has a high level of capital intensity, with investments in plants and equipment accounting for a sizeable portion of industry revenue. These rates are significant, in large part because operators have invested a lot in capital projects to generate new product lines more effectively and replace deteriorating machinery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Gypsum Product Manufacturing industry in the U.S. can be considered moderately labor-intensive. The manufacturing process for gypsum products involves a range of tasks that require varying levels of manual labor, including mixing, pouring and finishing.

Burgeoning manufacturers will have to contend with high input prices and labor costs. The industry is highly labor-intensive and requires access to extensive distribution networks, which is expensive.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Industry performance is tied to downstream demand
volatility_points.volatility_description: Gypsum product manufacturers are beholden to the cyclical nature of the construction sector. Any dramatic changes in construction activity or macroeconomic shifts affecting consumer spending habits can potentially impact revenue volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: HIGH MARKET SATURATION AND SIMILAR PRODUCT OFFERINGS
volatility_points.volatility_description: Due to significant market saturation and identical product offerings, industry leaders are now competing based on price, which could endanger the ability of individual manufacturers to raise their revenue. Still, the consistent need for gypsum products used in construction, remodeling and repair projects has increased profits.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The manufacturing of gypsum products is recognizing the need to lessen its impact on the environment and is using sustainable practices, such as obtaining gypsum from recycled materials and waste streams from other businesses that produce byproducts. Using recycled materials lessens the need to extract virgin gypsum from quarries, which can have an adverse effect on the environment and lowers waste.

The manufacturing of gypsum products has experienced considerable technological advancements that have transformed production methods. These developments have produced more automated, effective methods that help to lower manufacturing costs while enhancing the uniformity and quality of gypsum products.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: The largest and most profitable companies focus primarily on the residential construction and home improvement markets. This segment is primarily comprised of drywall.

FAQs.question: Have export opportunities offered an opportunity for your company?
FAQs.answer: Trade is a small component of revenue for domestic companies.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Companies are investing in new types of wallboards that meet more eco-friendly standards.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices?
FAQs.answer: Decreases in input prices aid profit margin for well-run operations.

FAQs.question: Does your company use SAP software systems to optimize all aspects of manufacturing, sales, inventory and distribution channels?
FAQs.answer: Supply management is a key factor in generating higher profit margins and maintaining strong sales relationships.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: As larger companies take market share they can better leverage technology, which could mitigate overall wage costs.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Companies invest heavily in making lighter and more efficient products. Asbestos compliance has been a major problem for operators.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The Gypsum Association provides significant aid to the companies that make gypsum products.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit for companies has been volatile as the price of gypsum has increased during the period.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Gypsum product sales are seasonal. Spring to Autumn is the strongest selling season as this period is the most active for home sales.

FAQs.question: How do you adapt to changes due to environmental regulations? Have you had any issues in the past?
FAQs.answer: Producers of gypsum products must ensure their manufacturing techniques and end products meet strict guidelines for environmental and consumer health.

FAQs.question: Are your inputs eco-friendly and reliable? Have you had problems in the past?
FAQs.answer: Gypsum product manufacturers require access to satisfactory raw materials (natural or synthetic gypsum) and paperboard. The mining process includes a high usage of the explosive ammonium nitrate, which emits large quantities of nitric acid and ammonia into the atmosphere.

FAQs.question: In what ways have you innovated your service offerings? Have you done market research to identify untapped niche demand?
FAQs.answer: Successful gypsum manufacturers develop improved products. Enhancements focus on reducing weight or adding new features, including enhanced fire resistance, exterior surfaces, moisture resistance, mold resistance and acoustic quality.

FAQs.question: How will you alter your product offering to cater to varying markets as the home mortgage rate increases?
FAQs.answer: Residential structures are one of the largest markets for industry products and these structures tend to be purchased via mortgages. Therefore, as the mortgage rate increases, the effective cost of buying a home rises.

FAQs.question: Are you prepared for an upturn in housing starts? How will you capitalize on this trend?
FAQs.answer: New homes rely heavily on wallboard for interior walls and may also feature gypsum-based plaster moldings and cornices.

FAQs.question: How much do you depend on the private spending on home improvements? What do you do when spending is slow?
FAQs.answer: An increase in private spending on home improvements boosts industry demand. This consumer spending follows a low volatility trend since improvements tend to be necessary and less speculative than new construction projects, creating stability.
